overview.business_description: French retail group providing food and non-food retailing through Auchan supermarkets/hypermarkets, real estate development (shopping centers), and payment services. Operates physical stores across Europe (France, Poland, Portugal, Italy, Spain).
business_positives: Bonds still trading ABOVE PAR (101-104) despite distress score
Proactive: Early redemption of EUR 1bn Jan 2026 notes
Recently refinanced with new RCFs and TL to Oct 2030
overview.fatal_flaw: HIGHEST DISTRESS SCORE of 39 in portfolio. EBITDA collapsed 48% from 2022 ($1.4bn → $821m). Net leverage at 6.1x is dangerous. Large net losses (-$1bn annually). EBITDA margin compressed to 2.1%. European retail structurally challenged.
overview.recent_news: Launched early redemption of EUR 1bn notes due Jan 2026 (Dec 2025). Completed EUR 425m shareholder support (Nov 2025). Considering strategic partnership change with Intermarché. Court ruling on employment protection plan (appealing).

trend_analysis.trend_summary: EBITDA collapsed 48% from 2022. Leverage spiked. Large net losses.

maturity_schedule.note: EUR 1bn Jan 2026 notes being early redeemed

credit_opinion.summary: Elo/Auchan is a STRESSED Ba1/BB- credit with the HIGHEST DISTRESS SCORE (39) in your portfolio. EBITDA has collapsed 48% from 2022 ($1.4bn to $821m). Net leverage at 6.1x is dangerously high. Large annual net losses of ~$1bn. However, bonds still trade above par (101-104) reflecting family support and liquidity actions. The Mulliez family injected EUR 425m and proactively redeemed the Jan 2026 notes. The market is betting on family support, but fundamentals are deteriorating rapidly.
key_risks: HIGHEST distress score of 39 - CRITICAL WARNING
Net leverage at 6.1x - very high for retail
EBITDA margin at 2.1% - thin and declining
Employment issues - court ruling being appealed
key_catalysts: Continued family support and capital injections
Asset sales from real estate portfolio

distress_indicators.trading_signals: Bonds at 101-104 (above par) with 4.0-4.7% YTW despite 39 distress score. Market pricing family support. Disconnect between distress score and bond pricing is notable.
